fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA has only one mail queue and the processing of the queue is synchronous (1 by 1) and hence an item in the mail queue that is taking a very long time to process (e.g a large amount of recipients on a filter subscription could take a long time to execute) could cause other email notifications to back up considerably on the mail queue. The impact on this is that other critical notifications may be delayed at the expense of the long running filter subscription.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if the mail queue could process mails asynchronously to reduce the chance that other notifications get delayed and back up due to a long running item in the queue.

h3. Workaround 
* If you have identified notifications taking a long time to process e.g. filter subscriptions for a large number of recipients, you may want to reschedule this kind of subscriptions to run at off-peak period and not too regularly.
* It is also possible to use the *Bypass currently sending mail* feature to suspend the long running mail item to all other notifications to go through quicker.
fields.summary: Asynchronous processing of the Mail Queue

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is recommended to have one branch per issue in JIRA as if a trigger is configured to transition the issue and there are multiple branches in JIRA, it is not possible to transition the issue when  all open branches are merged? The issue will transition when any of the brances are merged regardless if the others are not merged.

h3. Suggested Solution
I would be nice if there is a way to restrict one branch per project
fields.summary: Restrict one branch per issue in JIRA

h3. Summary
Contructing a Korean word at Inline issue Create on project -> issues tab and Agile Board using Internet Explorer does not work as expected. Instead it shows each individual Korean character. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.3.15
* JIRA Agile 6.7.12
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Please refer to this video clip: http://screencast.com/t/veDYm10Jzu

h3. Expected Results
Please refer to this video clip: http://screencast.com/t/Y8m495xjws

h3. Actual Results
Please refer to this video clip: http://screencast.com/t/veDYm10Jzu

h3. Notes
* How to setup Korean language keyboard: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-desktop/how-can-i-type-in-korean-characters-in-windows-7/126cc1a6-251d-4867-bb01-2d15a098cd9b?auth=1
* How to contruct a word with Korean language: http://www.koreanfluent.com/cross_cultural/korean_keyboard/korean_keyboard.htm
* The word in the video clip is {{fruit}} in Korean. Type {{dufao}} to construct the word in Korean. 

h3.Workaround
* Use different browser such as Google Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Can't construct word in Korean language at Inline Issue Create in Project Issues Tab and Agile Board using IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60046].
  {panel}

We really appreciate the work that was done to allow creating issues from tables in a Confluence requirements page, but we're lacking some function that would make it perfect for our uses.

The big one would be allowing linking sub-tasks to Story issues, much as you do with allowing linking of Story to Epic (when it works, which it's not currently due to some known bug).

Here's our use case:  When we create our Requirements Docs for a project we define several Epics, and User Stories, and we write all of the sub-tasks to fulfill the user story.  As it is now we have to manually create all of the sub-tasks (we open the Story issue and create sub-tasks one at a time).
If when we highlighted a table with our sub-tasks, and could choose a Story that existed on the page for linking, it would save us a tremendous amount of time.

If my description of this is not clear I'd love a chance to try explaining again.  Let me know.
fields.summary: Better workflow when creating JIRA issue from Confluence page

h4. +Summary+
In JIRA's Advanced Settings, the parameter *jira.text.field.character.limit* is used to specify the text limit for Description, Environment, Comments, and Text custom fields. However, this doesn't affect the Worklog description and there's no way to do that.

h4. +Suggestion+
Make the parameter *jira.text.field.character.limit* control the text limit of the Worklog description as well
\- _OR_ -
Add a new parameter to do this.
fields.summary: Ability to set Text limit for Worklog description

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60034].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to changes made to Gadget rendering implementation since JIRA 7.1 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59892). Users terminating SSL on Apache with a self-signed certificate would now need to import the certificate into Tomcat as well, so that java trusts it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a section for self-signed certificate configuration, that includes importing the certificates into tomcat/Java trust-stores as explained in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Unable+to+Connect+to+SSL+Services+due+to+PKIX+Path+Building+Failed
fields.summary: Update Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL documentation for Self-signed certificate SSL configuration in JIRA 7.1+

h4. Problem
As of the supported platform for JIRA, the latest supported version of SQL Server is 2014 ([support introduced as of JIRA 7.1|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-39055]).

SQL Server 2016 is soon to be released: [http://www.microsoft.com/en/server-cloud/products/sql-server-2016/]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60023].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The supported platforms documentation for [JIRA 6.3.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/supported-platforms-683541780.html] and [6.4.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] currently states that Java 7 and 8 are both supported. Although the application functions properly with Java 7, but there are a large number of cases - especially when it comes to medium to large instances - when the performance on Java 7 is significantly worse than it is on Java 8, not to talk about the same instance running on earlier versions of JIRA.

h4. Proposed solution
We already have a [knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Java+8+improves+JIRA+application+performance+dramatically] that describes the performance gain on Java 8, but customers who upgrade or install JIRA will not necessarily browse through the KB space. 

We should mention the significant performance impact when using Java 7 in both the supported platforms documentation and the related upgrade documentation to clarify the situation and avoid post-mortem suggestions for customers being affected by this issue.

We should probably also evaluate removing Java 7 as supported platform for these versions, given the number of performance related issues we see.

h5. References
- [*Java 8 improves JIRA application performance dramatically*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Java+8+improves+JIRA+application+performance+dramatically]
- [JIRA 6.3.x supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/supported-platforms-683541780.html]
- [JIRA 6.4.x supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html]
- [JIRA 6.3 upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-3-upgrade-notes-596771073.html]
- [JIRA 6.4 upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-4-upgrade-notes-687014821.html]
- [Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/upgrading-jira-185729508.html]
fields.summary: Documentation request: Indicate possible performance problems with Java 7 and JIRA 6.3.x+

Hello,
I'm evaluating the JIRA7 for our future migration from JIRA6.4.
The new "Users and roles" section in the project administration is a nightmare...

When using the "Add users to a role" function, it would be interesting to have the list of roles showing ONLY roles that the user does not already belong to. Because the new screen layout does not allow to see clearly and at first glance if the user already has been added to the roles (if you have MANY roles, even if you filter roles by the user, you need to scroll down the full list)...

Regards
Gael
fields.summary: Restrict role list entries when adding a user to non-affected roles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60014].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Whenever JIRA imports data (screen, workflow, anything). It firstly checks if such an element exist. If it does but cannot be reused then it creates the element with a changed name.
For example, you import a workflow but your current JIRA already contains "Ready to View" node but it differs in type. The workflow import then renames the imported node as "Ready to View - 2".
When you then proceed to import a project will find that the flow is incorrect as the project import "forgets" the "Ready to View" is now "Ready to View - 2" and the project import does not proceed.
Another example are Screens during the actual project import.
When the project import process find out that "Default" screen configuration already exist then it creates "Default - 2" then it proceeds with the project import but it associates it with "Default" rather than "Default - 2".

h3. Suggested Solutions
# Give user an option to stop importing when a change of name is necessary. Just inform the user that "Ready to View" exists but is not compatible because it has a different type.
The user then has the option to abort the import and fix the problem or he will have an option to ignore and proceed with "Ready to View - 2"
#  Having original element name. When you import a workflow and it gets renamed to "Ready to View - 2" then the project import will find out that the workflow doesn't fit the import but the incorrect elements have expected original name and the project import can proceed.
fields.summary: Project Import - Duplicate Names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60013].
  {panel}

Hello,
I'm evaluating the JIRA7 for our future migration from JIRA6.4.
The new "Users and roles" section in the project administration only displays the 5 first users in each role, which is not handy to have a global look.
There is a "show all" button for each role, but then the screen will only display all users of that unique role.
I would like to have a global view of ALL users in ALL roles, like we had in JIRA6 before.

Besides the new screen layout makes it very difficult to see all the roles/users at once, even with 5 users limit, as soon as you have many roles => you need to scroll down ... I'm not sure that displaying ALL info about each user (id, name, email, session) is a real benefit for day-to-day project management... I liked very much better the previous JIRA6 roles screen...

See screenshots.

Regards
Gael
fields.summary: Allow to expand ALL roles in the "Users and roles" section

h3. Problem Definition
Users need a way to query for issues based on whether they have subtasks or not
h3. Suggested Solution
# If a top level issue has no subtasks, count it as 1 in the WIP limit.
# If a top level issue has N subtasks, count it as N in the WIP limit (i.e., count only the subtasks for the WIP limit).
fields.summary: Allow to find Jira issues with subtasks

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60009].
  {panel}

+*OBSERVED*+
In pie charts, the percentage numbers shown are not the nearest integer to the actual value. It seems the integer shown is calculated by rounding down that real value.

*+EXPECTED+*
As an example, take a look on the image attached: In a chart with 41 issues to represent
* 31 are marked as VERIFIED. They represent 31*100/41 = 75.61% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 76%
* 6 are marked as CLOSED. They represent 6*100/41 = 14.63% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 15%
* 4 are marked as CLOSED. They represent 4*100/41 = 9.76% of the total. The nearest integer to this number is 10%
fields.summary: Percentage shown in charts should be the nearest integer

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment and only  Issue Updated Notification is triggering. 

Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA (outbound email must be working, )
# Select any existing JIRA issue that you reported  (Assign ticket to different user)
# Click on Edit and add any comment on below edit screen
# Click update 

Actual Results:
The assignee will receive an email notification that issue has been updated. 


h3. Suggested Solution
The assignee should receive both {{Issue Updated}} and {{Issue Commented}} notification emails if comment is added using {{edit screen}}.

 
h3. Workaround 
- When adding a comment in a issue, just use the "comment" button in issue screen.
fields.summary: Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59998].
  {panel}

Currently full changelog is returned when using {{expand=changelog}} in {{/search}} or {{/issue}} endpoint. It may cause OOM easily. At least in JIRA Cloud such requests are killed with timeout error, quite often.

It would be much better if only 100 changelog entries were returned by {{/search}} or {{/issue}} enpoint, and new {{/issue/\{idOrKey\}/changelog}} endpoint would then return full history on request.

Note, this technique is used for worklog currently.

See also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/316418/iterate-through-changelog-history-with-rest-api and https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issues/760/timesheet-report-gadget-generates-timeout
fields.summary: Limit changelog to 100 entries, and add /changelog endpoint for full history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59992].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently in JIRA if users list issues according to the FixVersions, JIRA will be listing the Issues according to the Issue Key and after that according to FixVersions value. This is because versions are project specific and the sort order is defined by the arrangement of the project versions within the project configuration.

 !FixVersions ORDER Bug.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested Solution*
Allow users to sort issues by Fix Versions value even though they are searching for issues from multiple projects.

*Workaround*
Currently there's no workaround for this.
fields.summary: List Issues in Issue Navigator according to FixVersions regardless of Issue Key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59991].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
In JIRA 7, it's possible that each Application uses a different User-tier for its license. It seems that an add-on license is always checked against the Application with the higher/highest User-tier.

h4. +Scenario+
# Install JIRA Software 7
# Use JIRA Software 10-user license
# Use JIRA Core 25-user license
# Install an add-on and use a 10-user license for it

The add-on can be configured to be used by only those users who have JIRA Software access, however this doesn't matter as the add-on license is checked against JIRA Core license, which makes it *incompatible*.

(i) The same behavior is observed when JIRA Software uses 25-user license and JIRA Core uses 10-user license.

h4. +Suggestion+
Since this seems to be the way UPM has always checked for add-on licenses, it should be well documented somewhere. This is necessary in JIRA 7, where each application can use a different user-tier.

(!) Another suggestion may be to make it possible for an add-on to only work with one specific application, against which its license is checked.
fields.summary: Document how Add-on license is checked when there are multiple Applications with different User-tiers

*Issue Summary*
When a user wants to find all tickets that were last updated by a specific user, using JQL, they would realize that JIRA has no feature to accomplish this as the updated parameter finds all ticket that were recently updated but not necessarily by the user.

*Feature Request*
Can a feature that gets who made the last comment or change from the history section be added so that users can then have a field like {{lastchangeby}} to use to filter the issues better?
fields.summary: Add a feature that allows retrieving issues last updated by a specific user

h3. +Summary+
Currently, the Pie Chart on the Wallboard is displayed in a different format from that as a Dashboard Gadget. The latter is displayed as a doughnut but the former appears as a flat circle with labels, and the labels are too small.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a Dashboard and add a Pie Chart
(/) the chart is displayed as a doughnut:
!gadget.png|thumbnail!
# view the dashboard as Wallboard

h3. +Expected behavior+
The chart is still displayed as a doughnut

h3. +Actual behavior+
The chart is displayed as a flat circle with small labels (old layout):
!wallboard.png|thumbnail!

h3. +Suggestions+
It will be ideal if:
* user is able to customize the label size of the Wallboard Pie Chart
_OR_
* the Pie Chart format remains consistent on both Dashboard and Wallboard
fields.summary: Pie Chart Formats are not Consistent with Small Labels on Wallboard

When adding users to a JIRA instance that has less than five accounts not including the System Administrator account, the following form is presented to add users:

!presixusers.png|thumbnail!

This form does not allow you to opt out of the standard JIRA invite. Some customers do not want an invite sent. For example in cases where they want to manually add Service Desk customers so no invite is sent.

Instead, a customer should just see the following add user form:

!postsixusers.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59982].
  {panel}

When a user performs a search using status as a condition and saves it as a filter, if he deletes one of the statuses and then attempts to view the filter in Issue Navigator.

Users would be presented the following error:
{code}The value 'Terminate' does not exist for the field 'status'.{code}

Steps to replicate:
# Create a custom workflow and add in a custom Status {{Terminate}}
# Associate the Workflow with a project.
# Search for issues with status in (Resolved, Terminate, Close).
# Save a filter based on this.
# Associate a different workflow with the project.
# Delete or rename the status {{Terminate}}
# Go back to the search issue screen and select the filter you saved.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would ignore the status that is wrong and proceed to search for the other status conditions.

*Actual Result*
JIRA throws the error mentioned earlier.
fields.summary: JIRA Status Search Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59980].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 22 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for voting and commenting on this request. After taking into account actual usage of different webhook events and potential workarounds for restricting them, we decided to action in the following ways:
 # We are splitting this collective request into separate issues - each for individual webhook event - in order to make it more clear what is the status of JQL support for each of webhook events respectively, and to give you opportunity to express demand for specific improvements. From now on you can refer to the following issues for JQL filtering of:
 ## Comment webhooks - JRACLOUD-68235
 ## Attachment webhooks - JRACLOUD-68594
 ## Worklog webhooks - JRACLOUD-68595
 # Since December 2017, JQL filtering is available for Comment webhooks. For the remaining webhook events, it is still possible to restrict them by [substituting variables in the webhook URL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#variable-substitution-in-the-webhook-url].
 # We have updated [Jira Cloud Webhooks documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/] to make it more clear that JQL filtering is only supported for a subset of webhook events, and what those events are.
 # As of January 2018 JQL filtering of Attachment, Worklog and Issue Link webhooks (as well as others not mentioned as JQL enabled in the documentation) is not supported, and that works by design. Therefore, adding such functionality is treaded as improvement suggestion in the newly created issues.
 # At this moment we do not have plans to add JQL filtering for the remaining webhook events, but we can revisit that decision in the future.
 # As a consequence of splitting the issue, and because the main use case was addressed, we’re closing as Fixed.

We understand that your expectations expressed in this issue have not been fully addressed, but after balancing the value of competing priorities we’ve determined that focusing on Comment webhooks would provide the biggest value for Jira Cloud app developers. To that end, I hope you appreciate the transparency of this update.

Regards,
 Eve Stankiewicz
 Product Manager, Jira Cloud Platform
{panel}
*Original request description:*
h3. Summary

JQL filter for Webhooks doesn't work correctly when the following related events are fired:
 * _Comment_
 * _Worklog_
 * _attachment_
 * _issuelink_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an webhook as follows
 ** Issue related events
 *** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
 *** Issue: created, updated
 *** Issue link: created deleted
 *** Comment: created, updated
 *** Worklog: created,updated
 *** Attachment: created, deleted
 !webhooks.png|thumbnail!
 # Make a comment, log work, upload an attachment or link an issue in a project aside from the one which is specified with the JQL

h3. Expected Results

The webhook shouldn't be fired.
h3. Actual Results

The webhook was fired.
h3. Notes

When it comes to *NOT* "Comment" or "Worklog" related events (like creating issue, updating issue),
 the JQL filters the events correctly.
fields.summary: JQL filter for Webhooks doesn't work correctly when "Comment", "Worklog", "Attachment" or "IssueLink" related events are fired

On a JIRA Cloud instance, when you export searched issues to Excel, the column belonging to any date fields displays results in two different formats for the same column, depending on the month:

*dd/MMM/yyyy* (ie: 17/Jan/2016)
* January
* April
* August
* December

*dd/MM/yyyy* (ie: 15/02/2016)
* February
* March
* May
* June
* July
* September
* October
* November

It would be desirable to have them all in the same format, preferably yyyy-MM-dd (ie: 2016/01/23).
fields.summary: Mixed date formats exported to Excel. Update docs

The following overview illustrates this:

||REST Create Project attribute|| supported||
|issueSecurityScheme  | (/) can be set |	
|permissionScheme     | (/) can be set |	
|notificationScheme   | (/) can be set |	
|workflowScheme       | (x) can not be set |	
|issueTypeScheme      | (x) can not be set |	
|issueScreenScheme      | (x) can not be set |	

In order to be able to fully automate project setup it would be beneficial to be able to configure these aspects too.

h3. Summary
JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & Licenses. JIRA Core displays a message that an upgrade is available, but there isn't a similar message for either JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Software. This is especially confusing for users that don't have a JIRA Core license placed, as they don't believe that they are able upgrade to JIRA 7.1.x.

Consequently, they don't actually click the "Download" button, and don't believe that there's an upgrade path to JIRA Service Desk 3.1.x or JIRA Software 7.1.x.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.0.10 with JIRA Service Desk 3.0.10, but JIRA Core does not have a license.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access to *Versions & Licenses* page.

h3. Expected Results
The notification for JIRA Service Desk and JIRA Software should display a more appropriate and less confusing message regarding possible upgrade paths.

h3. Actual Results
The upgrade notification is confusing to some users.
fields.summary: Message "JIRA Core 7.1.x is now available" upgrade message is confusing

This bug is related to JRA-36670 which regards losing content while hitting the escape button. The resolution of JRA-36670 is a bit controversial, it has a resolution won't fix and explanation that it is "by design". However people report that they lose content while accidentally pressing the escape button.

This bug regards editing a description of an issue, and clicking File->Save Page As, or  pressing the keyboard shortcut ctrl-s. The dialog for choosing a file name appears. When clicking the cancel button a user returns to editing an issue, but while hitting the escape button instead, the dialog closes which is correct behavior, but simultaneously all updates to description are lost.
I think the escape button should have the action "close the dialog" and nothing else.

I have the habit of pressing ctrl-s, and after that pressing the escape button. Due to this I lose content very often.

It would be great to be able to disable these WARNINGS on the log. Unfortunately it doesn't work by changing the logging level on the Logging & Profilling page for the classes: *com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent* & *com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.filterFormParameters*

Change the logging level for the com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent class in the conf/logging.properties file by adding this line:

Error is not triggered specifically for TimeSince gadget only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59871].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

After connecting JIRA to SSL or HTTP as per 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html

Old urls for filters and issues that are still using the HTTP protocol is not properly redirected to HTTPS.

When trying to access those HTTP or non SSL urls for the filters or issues 
* User is logged out of JIRA
* Page not redirected to the new HTTPS link as it should. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Adding :
{code}
<url-pattern>/issues/*</url-pattern>
{code}

to the  <web-resource-collection> on the {{web.xml}} file. This is not documented on  :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html

It would be great if this documentation is updated to :
{code}
<security-constraint>
  <web-resource-collection>
    <web-resource-name>all-except-attachments</web-resource-name>
    <url-pattern>*.jsp</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>*.jspa</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>/browse/*</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>/issues/*</url-pattern>
  </web-resource-collection>
  <user-data-constraint>
    <transport-guarantee>CONFIDENTIAL</transport-guarantee>
  </user-data-constraint>
</security-constraint>
{code}
fields.summary: Documentation : Filter and Issues page not redirected after integrating JIRA with SSL or HTTPS

h5. Experienced Behavior:

After creating a project the Default Issue Type Scheme is not automatically updated to include issue types created during project creation. 
* The Default Issue Type Scheme must include all issue types. These types not being included in the Default Issue Type Scheme causes errors when performing actions in JIRA

h5. Expected Behavior:

All issue types are added to Default Issue Type Scheme when the issue types are added to JIRA. The description of this scheme indicates it should be automatically updated.
** "Default issue type scheme is the list of global issue types. All newly created issue types will automatically be added to this scheme."

h5. Steps to Reproduce:

# Start with new JIRA 7 instance
# Install JIRA Software 
#* Notice two issue types (epic, story) are created automatically and appear in the Default Issue Type Scheme.
# Create new JIRA Software project
#* Notice that new issue types have been created and a new issue type scheme has been created for that project. This new scheme contains the issue types defined in the project template. 
#* The default issue type scheme is not updated to include the issue types that were added during project creation.

h5. Workaround:

* JIRA Server
Follow the instructions in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error] to add the issue types to the scheme

* JIRA Cloud
Open a support ticket at [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to have those issue types added.
fields.summary: Default Issue Type Scheme not updated when Issue types are added during project creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59863].
  {panel}

JIRA client should have Ajax (asynchronous JavaScript and XML) callbacks for ticket updates, specifically for comments and assignees.
While we are browsing through a JIRA ticket, we often keep one page per JIRA while working on other issues or viewing other JIRA tickets in other browser tabs/windows.
It looks like JIRA does not have Ajax support as of now. And since it doesn't update the existing page with Ajax callbacks, often times we lose track of the latest comments made by others, while we're writing a comment or viewing a JIRA ticket. This can lead to confusing inconveniences because of the race conditions that take place between the last refresh timestamp of the page and submitting a new comment or change for the ticket.
This use case is particularly important while we are dealing with Escalation issues (i.e. CPSDEVESC) that sometimes requires almost immediate notification on the currently while we're working on the currently open windows.
While comment Ajax refresh functionality is the most important aspect, it would be also a non-trivial benefit if JIRA pages can support Ajax callbacks for any and all updates on any field on the page (e.g. type, description, assignee).
Without this feature, we constantly have to refresh all the pages for all the jira tickets that are open in our browsers, which makes it impossible to get the latest update feed once we start to write a comment, since we can not refresh the page while writing a comment or making a change on one part of the ticket.
fields.summary: JIRA client should have Ajax callbacks for ticket updates, specifically for comments and assignees.

Steve King

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when you click on the edit button of an issue. Then JIRA retrieves the fields and values of the field and after a user makes a modification, then all the fields of the relevant tables are updated. This could be an issue if we have two users who simultaneously open the edit, where the first user makes a change like removing a label and submits the change. However, then later the second user makes a change to another field and submits. As in his submission the label is still included, therefore the label field will be re-added.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Therefore we would like a mechanism where only modified fields are updated instead of all the fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59832].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Previously in JIRA version 7.0.10 and older, when user import XML backup even with Agile data, JIRA will be upgrading all the Agile data automatically. With JIRA 7.1.0, if the user tries to import a XML backup of a JIRA instance which is using JIRA Agile version 6.7 and below, they will be prompted with the following error:

* Sorry, your data contains JIRA Agile data from previous version that is not compatible for import. Please upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.7 and try again.*

*Suggested Solution*
Since prior to JIRA 7.1.0, JIRA was able to handle the upgrade task automatically, implemented the same upgrade task should be ideal for the users.

*Workaround*
User will have to upgrade their source JIRA instance's JIRA Agile to version 6.7 and above, create new XML backup and restore that backup in the target JIRA instance. 


{panel:title=Brydie McCoy [Atlassian] }
Unfortunately it was becoming too difficult to maintain older upgrade tasks, so in 7.1.0 the Agile team removed upgrade tasks older than 12 months.
You can either
Upgrade JIRA Agile to 6.7.x on their original instance (for JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 6.5). Or;
Import the data into a JIRA Software 7.0.0 instance first. (or upgrade the original instance to 7.0.0)
Both of these scenarios will run the required upgrade tasks.
Cheers,
JIRA Software Team
{panel}
fields.summary: JIRA 7.1.X Agile related update error

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59828].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Copied from [ACJIRA-513|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-513]:
When I call REST API using basic authentication and the user has a non-ASCII character in their name, e.g. 'ä', the status 401 (Unauthorized) is returned. The name:password string is converted into a byte array using UTF8 before base-64 encoding. I also tried ASCII, but that is not supposed to work anyway.
Please note that JIRA user names can contain non-ASCII characters (e.g. umlauts) and a user with such a name can log in to JIRA using the web UI. rest/auth/1/session processes names with non-ASCII characters fine as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 - Create a user with non-ASCII character name like "łukasz"
# Step 2 - Do rest call as the user. "curl -u łukasz:test http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-2"

h3. Expected Results
Issue json should be returned for the user.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Date: Thu, 18 Feb 2016 10:53:23 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=91304E14DAA60D5A14292013A062A13B; Path=/jira/; HttpOnly
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Vary: User-Agent
WWW-Authenticate: OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8090%2Fjira"
X-AREQUESTID: 1313x7361x1
X-ASEN: SEN
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATED_FAILED
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
See [ACJIRA-513|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-513] description and comments for more details.

h3.Workaround
Remove non-ascii character from user name
fields.summary: Basic authentication does not support non-ascii characters in usernames

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59822].
  {panel}

h4. Requirement
Currently, JIRA will log slow queries in {{atlassian-slow-queries.log}} that run longer than 400ms. This value is hardcoded, cannot be adjusted. It would be extremely beneficial for troubleshooting purposes to able to modify the threshold, to see less "noise" and focus on longer running queries only.

h4. Proposed solution
Either have a [system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/recognized-system-properties-for-jira-229180062.html] that would override the default value, or even a more administrator-friendly solution would be to have this adjustable runtime on the Administration UI.
fields.summary: Option to adjust slow queries log threshold
